title: The AHS: 1984 Credits Are a Spandex Slasher Nightmare
text:
FX Networks Photo: FX Networks

Ryan Murphy shared the title sequence for American Horror Story: 1984 on his Instagram Thursday morning. It’s a mix of Jane Fonda workout tape and 1980’s video nasty. The classic AHS theme song is reimagined as a jazzercise banger, as images of aerobic workouts are juxtaposed with an unseen slasher cleaning and sharpening his various blades. Emma Roberts gets top billing, with Billie Lourd coming in second. Will one of them be the typical 80’s Final Girl? No sign of Sarah Paulson in the titles, so it does indeed look like she’s giving season 9 either a complete miss or very little of her time. According to Murphy, the titles were done in collaboration with Corey Vega, whose fan edit sparked the idea for the murder and legwarmers mash-up. American Horror Story: 1984 premieres September 18 on FX.
description: Ryan Murphy dropped the American Horror Story: 1984 opening credits on his Instagram Thursday morning. The show stars Emma Roberts and Billie Lourd, Leslie Grossman, Matthew Morrison, and others. The sequence mixed jazzercise with murder.
